channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The small-business hiring engine is sputtering. Why that’s a red flag for the economy.
item.description: Without small businesses and their hiring, already precarious economic growth could be prone to a pullback.

item.title: My former mother-in-law left a $1 million estate. Can I sue my ex-husband for a share of it?
item.description: “My mother-in-law did not leave me anything in her will, but she should have.”

item.title: I inherited $600K in Apple stock. It now makes up 50% of my portfolio. Is that too risky?
item.description: “I worry that a downturn in the tech sector, or something Apple-specific, could wipe out half my portfolio.”

item.title: ‘I feel overwhelmed’: I’m a widow in my early 40s with 3 children. I have $330K in IRAs. Will be OK?
item.description: “Our paid-off home is valued at $590,000.”

item.title: ‘I thought she was honest’: My ex-wife hid stocks during our divorce. Can I sue her?
item.description: “I have contacted her about it, but she refuses to answer my calls.”

item.title: It’s time to recreate China’s robotics strategy in the U.S.
